definition: empty-handed (idiom); fig. not receiving anything
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time

sentences.english: She felt sad that she was coming home empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 她感到難過，她回家兩手空空。

sentences.english: And authorities doubt they are coming home empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 當局懷疑他們回家兩手空空。

sentences.english: I don't have any more philosophical arguments up my sleeve on this issue.
sentences.chinese: 我已兩手空空，拿不出什麼哲學論調了。

sentences.english: The bird-catcher was forced to go home empty-handed and without his revenge.
sentences.chinese: 鳥類捕手被迫回家兩手空空，沒有他的報復。

sentences.english: After six weeks, they came back empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 六個星期過後，他們兩手空空打道回府。

sentences.english: But Realmadrid one time counter-attacks successfully, we only end up to turn out to be penniless.
sentences.chinese: 可皇馬一次反擊成功，我們只落得個兩手空空。

sentences.english: The empty-handed males were mostly unsuccessful at mating.
sentences.chinese: 兩手空空的雄蜘蛛幾乎都未成功交配。

sentences.english: Macquarie and Newbridge go away empty-handed, at least for now.
sentences.chinese: 麥格理和新橋兩手空空地打道回府了，如此。

sentences.english: And what about the slew of males who come up empty-handed?
sentences.chinese: 對於兩手空空的男性，性別的失衡意味着什麼呢？

sentences.english: We searched hard but came up empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 我們努力搜索，卻兩手空空而歸。

definition: hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
to tease/to poke fun at
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
reluctant to part
to help with farm work/casual laborer
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to spare no effort
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
scene which recalls past memories (idiom)/evocative of the past/reminiscent/to arouse deep feelings
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to be content with what one is
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
